brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether a relationship exists between a previously
      established diagnosis of endometriosis and the consecutive risk of developing a clear cell
      or endometrioid ovarian carcinoma. All histopathological records since 1980 with these
      diagnoses (endometriosis, clear cell and endometrioid ovarian carcinoma) will be reviewed.
      Cancer registry data will be assessed to investigate differences in survival of women with
      endometriosis-associated ovarian carcinomas and those ovarian carcinoma patients without
      previous diagnosis of endometriosis.

clinical_study.brief_title: Endometriosis and Frequency of Endometriosis-associated Ovarian Carcinomas (EAOC)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  endometrioid ovarian carcinoma

          -  clear cell ovarian carcinoma

          -  endometriosis, atypical endometriosis

          -  borderline tumors with endometriosis

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  undifferentiated carcinomas

          -  germ cell tumors

          -  sex cord-stromal tumors

clinical_study.official_title: Endometriosis and Frequency of Endometriosis-associated Ovarian Carcinomas (EAOC) - Epidemiological and Molecular Pathological Aspects

overall_official.affiliation: University Hospital Basel, University of Basel
Institute of Pathology, University Hospital Basel, University of Basel

authority: Switzerland: Federal Office of Public Health

primary_outcome.measure: incidence and clinical outcome of endometriosis-associated ovarian carcinomas

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
